onyomiExamples.meaning: drinking (sometimes esp. alcohol), drink, drinking party
drinking habitually, being fond of (a drink)
food and drink, eating and drinking
consumption of alcohol (as prohibited by one of the Buddhist precepts), Buddhist precept prohibiting the consumption of alcohol

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to drink, to gulp, to swallow, to take (medicine), to smoke (tobacco), to engulf, to overwhelm, to keep down, to suppress, to accept (e.g. demand, condition), to make light of, to conceal
drinking, gambling, and buying women in prostitution
